physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Papilledema and receptive greater than expressive aphasia documented by decreased verbal fluency, poor repetition, and inability to follow simple midline commands.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Global aphasia was transient, resolving over 36 hours with IV saline and clinical observation.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Post-embolization EEG was improved, and a repeat brain SPECT scan demonstrated enhanced perfusion of the left frontoparietal lobe, especially in the left dorsolateral prefrontal cortex.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Post-embolization improvements were noted in mental state, with significant change described as becoming ambitious, engaging, increasingly talkative, and no longer depressed.
